name: Jailhouse Inn

reviews.text: I'll start with the positives: Staff was extremely friendly. Great parking and it was centrally located within walking distance of the main streets and restaurants. They had good wireless internet (although not included in the rate).
reviews.title: Dingy but centrally located

likes.disliked: — Beds were uncomfortable, room was dingy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the negatives: No elevator, had to carry my bag up three floors--no one offered to help. Once I got there, the room was stuffy and hot (about 90 degrees), no they didn't turn the air on prior to my arrival. There were two air conditioning units and only one seemed to work-- I didn't figure this out until the next day after sweating all night. The room had two queen beds, however the mattress (on each) was almost as hard as a wood plank--after several sleepless nights I came to believe that the beds must have been left over from the jail days. There were stains on the comforters and carpet. Overall, the room was dingy, the furniture was tired, and the whole effect was extremely depressing.
reviews.title: Great B&B

likes.disliked: — Lack of some hotel services...no concierge, wireless internet, pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was continental, but it was not what I would have expected from a B&B that was charging me $179 per night for the room. The coffee was good, but the other offerings were as depressing as the room. Instead I ate breakfast at the Corner Cafe located about a mile away.
reviews.title: Lackluster beginning to a honeymoon

likes.liked: — The helpful staff, and easy parking
likes.disliked: — The dinginess of the rooms, the breakfast

reviews.text: I was traveling for business and when I checked out I felt as if I had served time there. I doubt that I would ever recommend this to anyone, nor would I stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfort and space
Liked the Jailhouse Inn
reviews.text: Other recommendations: For an inexpensive but homey breakfast try the Corner Cafe on Broadway near the city hall and fire dept.

This is a great little hotel. My husband and I stayed here for two nights on our mini honeymoon in late August '05. It was just what we were looking for: a quiet, good value hotel with a quirky side. It's not deluxe, but more like a nice b&b.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The Jailhouse has gotten some not so stellar reviews since I stayed there. But I think this may have to do with its top rating on Tripadvisor. This isn't the Four Seasons; if you are looking for a super cushy hotel with bells and whistles, this isn't it.
reviews.title: Jailhouse...kind of a joke

reviews.text: Newport is an expensive town, but with the Jailhouse Inn you are getting one of the better deals in town.
reviews.title: Nice location and room
It's cheap and close to town... that's about all....
reviews.text: I read the reviews here of the Jailhouse Inn before booking two rooms; one for my parents and one for my husband and I. Based on the description on the Inn's website and in prior positive reviews I got the impression that the Inn would have some charm to it, have a feeling of having some real history, and be relatively nice. The whole experience ended up being rather mediocre.

The rooms were sparsely decorated, with little to suggest the Inn's historical significance. The blinds in both of the rooms we took were filthy; dirt was visible on them. The breakfast that came with the room was no better than in a Day's Inn. All in all the experience was not worth what we paid. Our rooms shouldn't have been more than $85 a night.
reviews.title: so-so
You can lock me up anytime at the Jailhouse Inn
reviews.text: Stayed 3 days and 2 nights at the Jailhouse Inn the week of July 4th. The room was clean and comfortable and the furnishings new. The continental breakfast was just enough and the coffee pot was on practically all day. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendlier. The Inn is centrally located and once you park your car (which is onsite and free), you can walk everywhere. This is the second year we stayed here and it keeps getting better. Can't wait until we go again.

We stayed two nights here the week of July 4th! Our room was spotless...our bed was fitted with the finest linens...very comfortable! We had two queen beds. The entire inn was so clean and attractive...neat surroundings...throwback of a jail in the late 1700s. History buffs will certainly appreciate the small history connections here. We did! The breakfast was always fresh...and tasty. In the afternoon we found cookies and tea and coffee. Just what we needed after much walking and exploring. This inn is conveniently located to all kinds of Newport treasures. The staff was courteous and helpful. We loved every minute of our stay. We would certainly stay here again! YAY!
reviews.title: no lawyer needed in this jailhouse!

reviews.text: $105 +tax walk in rate early season for a standard room. Quality furnishings, great big bed and good room size. Central location so excellent for shops and for local upmarket + mid priced restaurants- but therefore a bit of noise towards but not beyond midnight. Help yourself complimentary breakfast made it even better value. Friendly staff, clean room, nice bathroom with a small touch of elegance and luxury. Also gives you somewhere to park
reviews.title: a small touch of elegance
if it weren't for the outlets.........
reviews.text: The jailhouse inn is a nice place, the rooms are large, the price was right and the people are very nice. Also the breakfast was very good.

reviews.title: Most excellent!
reviews.text: One big problem with our room however was that upon inspecting why the clock did not work I noticed the outlet was falling right out of the wall......upon further inspection so were the other outlets, wich meant the tv nor one lamp worked.

reviews.title: Nice Place
reviews.text: This was a very cute hotel in a good location, within walking distance to Bannisters Wharf and lots of restaurants and shops. It isn't a typical bed and breakfast, decor is more like a hotel, but it was very clean and modern, breakfast wasn't extravagant but it was just what was needed, some muffins, bagels, toasts, hard boiled eggs and a variety of oatmeal and cereals. I would definitely reccomend this hoel and I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed one night at the Jailhouse Inn. It was a clean hotel and the inn keeper was friendly and attentive, but it was your basic hotel room. We unfortunately were stuck with 2 double beds (we couldn't choose when we booked and it was all that was left). There is no elevator so we had to carry our bags upstairs with us. It was not what I hoped for my honeymoon, BUT it was a great hotel for people who want to visit Newport for a decent price. It is in walking distance to the marina and shops and a value for families. If you are looking for a romantic hotel however, you may want to look at other options.
reviews.title: Clean, Good Value, Low Romance

reviews.text: The Jailhouse Inn was in a great location and perfect if you are the type to walk everywhere. The people at the inn were friendly, and it was pleasant to sit on the front porch and enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning. The rooms were plain, and the furniture was nothing special despite their claim that it had been remodeled in 2005. Not a romantic place to stay, but adequate. The towels were thin. The cookies provided in the afternoon were from a store, not fresh. The only eggs at breakfast were hard-boiled. I did not see any bacon as described in other reviews, just thinly sliced ham. The NYT paper was provided in the morning, which was nice.
reviews.title: Jailhouse was adequate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a vacation in Newport, which is a fabulous area itself, and staying at the Jailhouse let us experience it even more so!
reviews.title: Perfect Location, A definite success!
Perfect for me!
reviews.text: The location is wonderful - probably one of the best qualities of the Jailhouse: we easily walked "downtown" , were only 2 blocks from where we picked up our trolly tour, and only had to walk across the road to visit one of the most famous dining establishments - The White Horse!

description: Built in 1772, The Jailhouse Inn is a restored Colonial Landmark. Located in the heart of downtown, the Inn features modern rooms with just a touch of the original "Jail" theme. One block to Harbor, restaurants, shops and visitor center.
